message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.CV 

This paper is about natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning for text analytics applications. The paper discusses the standardization of NLP feature specification and the reuse of features across applications. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which focuses on natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also discusses machine learning, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the paper discusses information retrieval (IR) and artificial intelligence (AI), which could place it in cs.IR and cs.AI, respectively. Finally, the paper could also be relevant to computer vision (cs.CV) since it discusses feature engineering for text analytics applications.
